articles.title: 6x Tougher Than Kevlar: Spider Silk Is Spun by Genetically Modified Silkworms for the First Time - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Scientists in China have developed a method to produce spider silk from genetically modified silkworms, offering a strong, sustainable alternative to synthetic fibers with applications in various industries. Researchers have synthesized spider silk from genet…
articles.content: Chinese scientists have successfully synthesized spider silk from genetically modified silkworms, producing fibers far stronger than Kevlar. Published in the journal Matter, this groundbreaking study… [+3839 chars]
